channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Britain’s 'mini-budget' disaster should serve as a warning to the U.S., bond strategists say
item.description: Fears are mounting that the U.S. could soon experience its own version of Britain's "mini-budget" crisis.

item.title: Adani Group slams 'baseless' New York fraud and bribery charges
item.description: India's Adani Group has denied allegations of bribery and fraud made by U.S. authorities in relation to the group's chair Gautam Adani.

item.title: Nvidia shares open higher as investors digest third-quarter earnings
item.description: Despite nearly doubling sales year-on-year, Nvidia's third-quarter results show a slowdown from previous quarters.

item.title: Bitcoin hits fresh record, races toward $100,000 as rally continues
item.description: Bitcoin breached the $98,000 level for the first time as investors continued pricing in a second Donald Trump presidency.

item.title: Baidu posts 3% drop in third-quarter revenues, beating market expectations
item.description: Beijing-based Baidu operates one of the major web browser search engines in China, along with a frequently used maps app.

item.title: Adani vs. Hindenburg: How one of India's biggest empires descended into chaos
item.description: A timeline of Adani Group headlines since the publication of Hindenburg's report.

item.title: British regulators will soon announce competition remedies for the multibillion-pound cloud industry
item.description: The U.K. competition regulator will soon announce "behavioral" remedies to address anti-competitive practices in the cloud industry, two sources told CNBC.

item.title: AI systems could 'turn against humans': Tech pioneer Yoshua Bengio warns of artificial intelligence risks
item.description: There is a "fringe" who might be happy to see humanity replaced by machines according to tech pioneer Yoshua Bengio.

item.title: Billionaire Gautam Adani charged in New York with massive fraud, bribery scheme
item.description: Gautam Adani and others are accused in the New York indictment of paying Indian government officials $250 million to secure solar energy supply contracts.

item.title: Morgan Stanley CEO is bullish on stocks, says the U.S. economy is 'outperforming'
item.description: Ted Pick said that the U.S. and China have a mutually unified motivation to find solutions that could benefit both economies.

item.title: DOJ pushes for Google to break off Chrome browser after antitrust case
item.description: The Department of Justice is pushing a federal judge to make Google divest its Chrome internet browser as a remedy following the antitrust case.

item.title: Rafael Nadal has made $134 million in career prize money, will retire as No. 2 highest-earning tennis player ever
item.description: The 38-year-old's career earnings are surpassed only by Novak Djokovic's.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Could Nvidia’s greatest obstacle be itself?
item.description: There’s a concept called the “hedonic treadmill," which theorizes as people achieve success, their expectations rise. Nvidia seems a victim of this.

item.title: Adani investor GQG Partners' shares see worst day after Gautam Adani's indictment
item.description: The stock closed 19.32% lower on Thursday, the investment firm's steepest one-day fall since its listing on Oct. 2021.

item.title: Jim Cramer wants to buy this falling tech stock — and touts another reason to like Disney
item.description: The Investing Club holds its "Morning Meeting" every weekday at 10:20 a.m. ET.

item.title: Thailand legalizing same-sex marriage is likely to bring a flood of tourists
item.description: Thailand's same-sex marriage law could add 4 million tourists and $2 billion in tourism revenue per year, according to a report commissioned by Agoda.

item.title: Nvidia nearly doubles revenue on strong AI demand
item.description: Nvidia reported earnings after the bell. Here are the results.

item.title: ‘We are firing on all cylinders': Marriott CEO says business is solid despite corporate layoffs
item.description: Marriott International's business operations and growth are solid, Anthony Capuano told CNBC Travel Monday, despite layoffs and low domestic demand in China.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Is Nvidia its own worst enemy?
item.description: There’s a concept called the “hedonic treadmill," which theorizes as people achieve success, their expectations rise. Nvidia seems a victim of this.

item.title: Walmart hits new highs and Target dives after earnings as rivals diverge even more
item.description: Both discounters are contending with price-conscious shoppers, but Walmart reported improving trends with discretionary merchandise.

item.title: Alphabet's VC arm backs little-known SAP rival Odoo, boosting valuation to $5.3 billion
item.description: Odoo, an enterprise software startup rivalling SAP, boosted its valuation to $5.3 billion in a secondary share round led by Alphabet's VC fund and Sequoia.

item.title: European Central Banks warns of trade tension risks to euro zone financial stability
item.description: The Financial Stability Review also said weak growth was now a bigger threat to the 20-nation euro zone than high inflation.

item.title: Comcast to spin off cable networks as subscribers flee the bundle
item.description: Comcast on Wednesday announced the spinoff of its cable networks, including CNBC, MSNBC and E!.

item.title: FTX co-founder Gary Wang avoids prison time for role in crypto fraud
item.description: Gary Wang was the fifth former FTX executive to be handed a punishment for his role in the collapse of the crypto exchange in late 2022.

item.title: U.S. closes embassy in Kyiv over potential 'significant' air attack as tensions with Russia soar
item.description: The U.S. has closed its embassy in Kyiv, warning that it has "received specific information of a potential significant air attack" on Wednesday.

item.title: Ethics Committee deadlocks on releasing Matt Gaetz sex, drug probe report
item.description: The outcome means that the report on Matt Gaetz, who is President-elect Donald Trump's pick to be the next U.S. attorney general, will not be released for now.

item.title: Euro-dollar parity is back in focus as Trump win sparks trade jitters
item.description: The euro last traded at $1 and below in 2022, but fresh developments have put parity back on the agenda.

item.title: What Trump's return to the White House could mean for global bond yields
item.description: It is thought that Trump's pledge to introduce tax cuts and steep tariffs could boost economic growth — but widen the fiscal deficit and refuel inflation.

item.title: UK inflation surges above Bank of England's 2% target, curbing December rate cut expectations
item.description: The hike marks a sharp increase from the 1.7% rise recorded in September and exceeds the 2.2% forecast of economists polled by Reuters.

item.title: Japan exports rise more than expected in October, rebounding from 43-month low
item.description: Japan's trade deficit expanded to 461.2 billion yen ($2.98 billion), compared to September's revised figure of 294.1 billion yen.
